entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 29.1 a-b** *प्रेतराजवशं प्राप्तं सर्वभूतदुरत्ययम्*
Who is subjected to the yoke of the dead king?
A) Yudhiṣṭhira B) Bhīma C) Rājā (King) D) Kṛṣṇa
entry.answer: C) Rājā (King) • The verse refers to "prētarājavaśaṁ" (the yoke of the dead king), implying a ruler. • Yudhiṣṭhira and Bhīma are warriors, not kings in this context. • Kṛṣṇa is a prince, not a king here.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 29.2 a-b** *भक्त्या मतिमतां श्रेष्ठ सैव त्वामनुयास्यति*
Who are the "mātimitāṁ" (wise) that follow you?
A) Sages B) Kings C) Bhīma D) Rājā (King)
entry.answer: A) Sages • "Mātimitāṁ" (wise) refers to sages, not kings or warriors. • The verse emphasizes devotion to the wise. • Bhīma and Rājā are not mentioned as sages.
